section: Client acknowledges and agrees that all due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are guaranteed by the Company, regardless of whether the company receives required materials, documentation, or approvals in a timely fashion from the client. Delays will not affect the due dates.
explanation: This statement is contradictory because it asserts that the company guarantees due dates regardless of whether they receive necessary materials from the client on time. It's illogical to guarantee a deadline when dependencies are outside the company's control. This creates an in-text contradiction.

section: Client agrees that any unsolicited positive feedback Client provides to Company may be used in any Company marketing and/or advertising materials (i.e., customer testimonials). Client further agrees that Company may use and display the graphics and other web design elements of Client's website as examples of Company website design and development work. To maintain Company's portfolio credentials, and the integrity of any applicable copyrights, Company shall be entitled to place an unobtrusive credit in the footer on each page of Client's website.
explanation: While this clause outlines the Company's rights to use Client's feedback and website elements for promotional purposes, it lacks clarity regarding the scope and duration of this usage. The absence of explicit limitations on how long or where the materials can be used creates ambiguity. There are no limitations mentioned on the usage of the marketing and/or advertising material.

section: Company is obligated to continue providing Customer Service throughout the duration of this agreement, and may not alter or cease providing Customer Service. Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
explanation: This section presents a clear contradiction. It first states that the company is obligated to continue providing customer service and cannot alter or cease it. However, it then immediately states that the company can alter or cease providing customer service at its sole discretion without any liability. This creates a direct conflict in terms and an in-text contradiction.
